title: The Tamperer featuring Maya
text:
The Tamperer featuring Maya was an Italian <a href="dance%20music">dance music</a> <a href="musical%20ensemble">group</a> consisting of Italian <a href="record%20producer">record producer</a>s <a href="Fargetta">Mario Fargetta</a> and Alex Farolfi, and American <a href="singing">singer</a> Maya Days. Later, Giuliano Saglia and GianLuca Mensi would join the project. It achieved European success in 1998 with the chart-topping single "<a href="Feel%20It%20%28The%20Tamperer%20featuring%20Maya%20song%29">Feel It</a>".
Overview.
In 1998, the group became famous for its debut <a href="single%20%28music%29">single</a>, "<a href="Feel%20It%20%28The%20Tamperer%20featuring%20Maya%20song%29">Feel It</a>", which peaked at No. 1 in both <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a> and the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> in May of that year and was taken from the <a href="album">album</a> "Fabulous". This song was <a href="songwriter">written</a> by the American team of Steve Gittelman and Jim Dyke, and relied heavily on a <a href="sampling%20%28music%29">sample</a> of the <a href="The%20Jackson%205">Jacksons</a> hit "<a href="Can%20You%20Feel%20It%20%28The%20Jacksons%20song%29">Can You Feel It</a>".
The album spawned two more singles, "<a href="If%20You%20Buy%20This%20Record%20%28Your%20Life%20Will%20Be%20Better%29">If You Buy This Record (Your Life Will Be Better)</a>" (based on a sample from <a href="Madonna%20%28entertainer%29">Madonna</a>'s "<a href="Material%20Girl">Material Girl</a>"), and the Italy-only release "Step Out". The group returned in early 2000 to release its next (and final) single, "<a href="Hammer%20to%20the%20Heart">Hammer to the Heart</a>" (based on <a href="ABBA">ABBA</a>'s "<a href="Gimme%21%20Gimme%21%20Gimme%21%20%28A%20Man%20After%20Midnight%29">Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight)</a>"). This became a success also, where it became the group's third top-ten hit in the UK.
The producers also used the Tamperer alias to produce and remix other artists, such as <a href="Crystal%20Waters">Crystal Waters</a>.
